title: Ultraviolette UVLYNC allows e-two-wheelers to be charged at AC car charging stations
description: Ultraviolette has released a new charging component named the UVLYNC, which allows you to charge two-wheelers at any electric car AC charger. The UVLYNC is priced at Rs 2,999 and is compatible with a charger of any make.   The UVLYNC is for all electric two-wheeler users, not just F77 owners  It’s available at Ultraviolette dealerships and will soon be sold on its website  The UVLYNC, developed by Indian two-wheeler EV manufacturer Ultraviolette, addresses a major challenge for EV users: charging. It is a unique Type 2 charging component that attaches atop any two or three-pin socket, allowing users to charge their electric two-wheelers at car charging stations by plugging into any AC charger. With access to over 4,000+ AC charging stations and over 1 lakh Type 2 AC charging stations, the UVLYNC enables longer journeys for all EV users. Ultraviolette has made this technology accessible to all EV two-wheeler users, not just F77 owners. The UVLYNC is available at Ultraviolette dealerships and will soon be sold on the company’s official website. Also see: 258kph: Autocar India sets new Indian top speed record with Ultraviolette F99
author: Autocar India News Desk
excerpt: Priced at Rs 2,999, the UVLYNC is compatible with a charger of any make.

html:
Priced at Rs 2,999, the UVLYNC is compatible with a charger of any make.

Ultraviolette has released a new charging component named the UVLYNC, which allows you to charge two-wheelers at any electric car AC charger. The UVLYNC is priced at Rs 2,999 and is compatible with a charger of any make.  

  1. The UVLYNC is for all electric two-wheeler users, not just F77 owners 
  2. It’s available at Ultraviolette dealerships and will soon be sold on its website 

The UVLYNC, developed by Indian two-wheeler EV manufacturer Ultraviolette, addresses a major challenge for EV users: charging. It is a unique Type 2 charging component that attaches atop any two or three-pin socket, allowing users to charge their electric two-wheelers at car charging stations by plugging into any AC charger.

With access to over 4,000+ AC charging stations and over 1 lakh Type 2 AC charging stations, the UVLYNC enables longer journeys for all EV users. Ultraviolette has made this technology accessible to all EV two-wheeler users, not just F77 owners.

The UVLYNC is available at Ultraviolette dealerships and will soon be sold on the company’s official website.

Also see: 258kph: Autocar India sets new Indian top speed record with Ultraviolette F99
